page.title: 01GENERAL PAGE SALPERTON AREA
page.content: This is a traditional limestone cotswold landscape,totally agricultural,sparsely populated and little changed over the last half century.The land is mostly in the hands of a few large estates and gives an air of care and prosperity .There is one village with its large house and estate ,a farm hamlet,another farm with attendant cottages and a few smaller holdings.Almost all the population of working age is connected with the land,apart from half a dozen who work in nearby towns or have holiday homes there.There are no Service industries.Four Civil Parishes ,Hazleton,Hawling,Sevenhampton and Shipton converge.Population is well below the district ave. of 0.60 per hectare.It is likely to remain fairly static apart from a possible increase in holiday/second home purchase.
